item.title: Secondary Index Built on top of a Key-value Store
item.author: Xing Lin
item.description: Key-value stores such as RocksDB have been used as the storage engine in several databases (MySQL/Mongo/Rockset/FoundationDB). A database typically requires support of secondary indexes. To support secondary index, a common approach is to store the secondary index as yet another key-value pairs. Let’s take a look at the following example. Employee table userid (primary key) salary age Alice 40000 30 Bob 20000 23 Charlie 30000 30 David 20000 25 To store the user table, we can store each record using tableName,primary_key -> salary,age as key/value pairs.
